sentences.en: A fanfare of trumpets heralded the arrival of the King.
sentences.cn: 嘹亮的小号声宣告了国王驾到.

sentences.en: A fanfare was played as the queen entered.
sentences.cn: 女王驾到时,小号奏起欢迎乐曲.

sentences.en: A wreath was laid on the monument to a fanfare of trumpets.
sentences.cn: 在响亮的号角声中花圈被献在纪念碑前.

sentences.en: For a world first , the announcement came with remarkably little fanfare.
sentences.cn: 作为一项世界先例, 消息发布之低调令人吃惊.

sentences.en: Music A showy or ceremonious passage, such as a fanfare.
sentences.cn: 装饰乐句,花式吹奏:一段炫耀或讲究仪式的音乐, 例如小号曲.

sentences.en: She eventually returned to Thesme to little fanfare.
sentences.cn: 她最终默默无闻地回到泰斯姆.

sentences.en: Sound the fanfare. The royal armies are victorious once more.
sentences.cn: 吹响号角, 皇家部队又一次取得了胜利.

sentences.en: The 13 new banknotes were unveiled with great fanfare on July 31.
The bill passed both houses of the Legislature in June with little fanfare or debate.
sentences.cn: 6月份立法两院未经辩论悄悄地通过了此项议案.

sentences.en: The ceremony opened with a fanfare of trumpets.
sentences.cn: 典礼以一段号角的奏鸣开始了。

sentences.en: The departure of the South Korean prime minister was marked with little fanfare.
sentences.cn: 韩国首相悄无声息地离开了。

sentences.en: The product was launched amid much fanfare worldwide.
sentences.cn: 这个产品在世界各地隆重推出。

sentences.en: The royal visitor is saluted by a fanfare of trumpet.
sentences.cn: 皇室贵宾在嘹后的铜管乐曲中受到热烈欢迎.

sentences.en: The royal visitor was saluted by a fanfare of trumpets.
sentences.cn: 皇室贵宾在嘹亮的铜管乐曲中受到热烈欢迎.

sentences.en: Two elves at the front of the sleigh blew a trumpet fanfare.
sentences.cn: 雪橇前面的两个喜欢恶作剧的孩子在吹着小号曲.

words.tran_cn: 吹牛，炫耀；喇叭或号角嘹亮的吹奏声

trans.tran_en: A fanfare is a short, loud tune played on trumpets or other similar instruments to announce a special event
